title: Capacity overflow while running tests
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (56e9583 2024-01-30T12:30:23.386976000Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge test

### Operating System

macOS (Apple Silicon)

### Describe the bug

```
The application panicked (crashed).
Message:  capacity overflow
Location: library/alloc/src/raw_vec.rs:545

This is a bug. Consider reporting it at https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry

  ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━ BACKTRACE ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
                                ⋮ 8 frames hidden ⋮
   9: alloc::raw_vec::capacity_overflow::hf245ae7628167bdf
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  10: <T as alloc::vec::spec_from_elem::SpecFromElem>::from_elem::hb012b63362e764e1
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  11: alloy_dyn_abi::token::DynToken::decode_populate::hbf0a5155d804adc7
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  12: alloy_dyn_abi::token::DynToken::decode_populate::hbf0a5155d804adc7
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>

      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  14: alloy_dyn_abi::ext::abi::abi_decode::h335202a25b30a49c
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  15: foundry_evm_traces::decoder::CallTraceDecoder::decode_function_output::h35d4c4abab4aad21
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  16: foundry_evm_traces::render_trace_arena::{{closure}}::inner::{{closure}}::h1bc6646038270ae3
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  17: foundry_evm_traces::render_trace_arena::{{closure}}::inner::{{closure}}::h1bc6646038270ae3
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  18: foundry_evm_traces::render_trace_arena::{{closure}}::inner::{{closure}}::h1bc6646038270ae3
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  19: foundry_evm_traces::render_trace_arena::{{closure}}::hd72c603d15b3559f
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  20: forge::cmd::test::TestArgs::run_tests::{{closure}}::heda4efb0391cbaa5
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  21: forge::cmd::test::TestArgs::execute_tests::{{closure}}::h903a9d3a971a5c2f
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  22: forge::cmd::test::TestArgs::run::{{closure}}::h1dd0d6069f6dae30
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  23: foundry_cli::utils::block_on::h178600f41ba19c10
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  24: forge::main::h01773a3383f19bfb
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  25: std::sys_common::backtrace::__rust_begin_short_backtrace::h7828ee521285aebc
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  26: std::rt::lang_start::h7f67b452cebf7a4c
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
  27: _main<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
```

@DaniPopes this looks like the alloy dyn issue

@0xdapper do you have a repro for this?
It's this https://github.com/alloy-rs/core/pull/495 while decoding some function output for display in traces
